text: Andrew Murray Burnham (born 7 January 1970) is an English politician. He was a candidate in the 2010 Labour leadership election. As of 2012 Burnham was Shadow Secretary of State for Health within Ed Miliband's Shadow Cabinet. He is the Member of Parliament for the Leigh constituency in the United Kingdom. He was first elected in the 2001 general election. Burnham was born in Old Roan, Aintree, Lancashire and raised in Culcheth, Warrington. He is a member of the Labour Party.New Secretary of State for Culture, Media and Sport BACTA, 28 January 2008 On 5 May 2017, he was elected mayor of Greater Manchester. ==References== Category:Labour Party (UK) MPs Category:Members of the British House of Commons for English constituencies Category:UK MPs 2001–2005 Category:UK MPs 2005–2010 Category:UK MPs 2010–2015 Category:UK MPs 2015–2017 Category:Members of the Privy Council of the United Kingdom Category:British socialists Category:British feminists Category:English Roman Catholics Category:People from Warrington Category:1970 births Category:Living people Category:Alumni of the University of Cambridge Category:Directly elected British mayors Category:Secretaries of State for Health and Social Care Category:Politicians from Cheshire
